84-85Transport passengers
86-90&blacktriangleright;Action + Theme
91-100Roll twice
Quests
Bonds
Discoveries
Command Vehicle
Starship
Name

Your armed, multipurpose starship is suited for interstellar and atmospheric flight. It can comfortably transport several people, has space for cargo, and can carry and launch support vehicles. When you <u>Advance</u>, you may spend experience to equip this vehicle with module assets.

When you <u>Finish an Expedition</u> (dangerous or greater) in your starship and score a hit, this journey strengthened your ties to your ship and any fellow travelers. You and your allies may mark 1 tick on your bonds legacy track.

When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, you may roll +heart. If you do, <u>Endure Stress</u> (-1) on a weak hit or miss.

Integrity

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5

Impacts

Passengers

Cargo

Modules

Module
Engine Upgrade

Your vehicles finely-tuned engines speed your travels. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+edge) and roll a strong hit with 6 on your action die, take +2 momentum.

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u>, choose one (before rolling).<br> * Maneuver: Add +1 and take +1 momentum on a strong hit.<br> * Boost: Take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you make a desperate move to pursue a foe, escape a threat, or get in range, you may push your engines to their limit. If you do (decide after rolling), reroll any dice and count a weak hit as a strong hit. Then, <u>Withstand Damage</u> (-2).

Module
Expanded Hold

Your vehicle carries up to 3 cargo. When you gain +supply, you may convert it to +cargo. When you make a move +supply, you may add +cargo. When you <u>Sacrifice Resources</u>, you may instead suffer -cargo for any portion of the cost.

When you roll a miss or weak hit as you make a move to barter or negotiate, and you have at least 1 cargo, you may sweeten the pot. If you do, reroll all dice and add +cargo. Then, suffer -1 cargo.

When you make a move to outrun a threat and have at least 1 cargo, you may first lighten your load by dropping cargo. If you do, suffer -cargo by the amount dropped, add +that amount, and take +2 momentum on a hit.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
Module
Grappler

Your grappler can disrupt systems and snare machines and vehicles with a magnetic tether. When you take a minute or so to ready the grappler, roll +integrity or +wits. On a strong hit, the grappler is charged and may be fired. On a weak hit, charging requires extra time or focus and you <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1). On a miss, charging fails and you must <u>Withstand Damage</u> (-2). If you make a move to attack a foe or overcome an obstacle by firing the grappler, take an automatic strong hit.

If you score a strong hit when readying the grappler, you may <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> (-1) to overcharge the module. When you fire an overcharged grappler, take +2 momentum; if in a fight, also mark progress.

When you <u>Take Decisive Action</u> by firing the grappler, you may reroll one challenge die.

Module
Heavy Cannons

When you aim your cannons and use them to <u>Strike</u>, choose one.<br> * Strafing run: Add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.<br> * Focus fire: Mark progress on a hit, but <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1).

Once per fight, when you <u>Clash</u> by committing to an all-or-nothing exchange of fire, add +1, count a weak hit as a strong hit, and mark progress on a hit. On a miss, you must suffer a dire outcome.

When you <u>Compel</u>, <u>Enter the Fray</u>, or <u>Gain Ground</u> by bringing your cannons to bear and sending a promise of violence to your foe over communication channels, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, take another +1 momentum.

Module
Internal Refit

You have customized the cabins, common spaces, and environment of the ship to your needs. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (dangerous or greater), reroll any dice for the first leg of your journey. On a hit, you and your allies may envision how you make yourself at home; if you do, take +2 momentum or +1 spirit.

Your vessel is stocked with reserves. When you <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> and your supply is reduced to 0, first roll +integrity instead of marking unprepared. On a strong hit, take +1 supply. Otherwise, mark unprepared.

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> to oppose an invader within your vessel, reroll any dice. On a strong hit, take +momentum equal to integrity. On a strong hit with a match, also mark progress.

Module
Medbay

When you use your medbay to <u>Heal</u> yourself or another patient, you may reroll your action die if its value is less than your vehicles integrity.

When you or an ally mark the permanently harmed impact and are brought to the medbay without delay (less than an hour or so), you have a shot at making things right. If you <u>Heal</u> and score a strong hit, clear the impact (in addition to the other benefits of the move). Then, envision the scar that now serves as a reminder of the incident.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> by performing a risky medical procedure, or if you <u>Gather Information</u> through an autopsy or internal scan, reroll any dice and take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Missile Array

Your missile array is armed with 5 ammo. When you <u>Strike</u> or <u>Clash</u> with a missile attack, suffer -1 ammo and mark progress on a hit. If you <u>Resupply</u> in a place where your missiles can be replenished, you may exchange any earned +supply for +ammo.

When you have at least 1 ammo and <u>Gain Ground</u> by locking a missile on target, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you have at least 3 ammo and <u>Take Decisive Action</u> by unleashing all of your missiles, roll an action die before making the progress roll. If your action die is equal to or less than ammo, you may reroll each challenge die. Then, set ammo to 0.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5
Module
Overseer
Name

Your AI module keeps watch over the vehicles systems and sensor data. When you <u>Secure an Advantage</u> or <u>Gain Ground</u> by talking through a situation with the overseer, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Withstand Damage</u> and roll on the miss table, the overseer will do what it can to help. Roll twice on the table and choose either result.

The overseer can pilot the vehicle independently. When you <u>Face Danger</u> to hand over control to the AI in an emergency, or to summon the vehicle remotely, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Reinforced Hull

Your vehicle is clad in iron. When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, add +1. On a strong hit, take +1 momentum.

Your plated hull is given a fierce and distinctive color or design. When you arrive at a place where your reputation is a factor, take +1 momentum. When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> against a foe who would know your reputation, take +momentum equal to your vehicles integrity on a strong hit.

When you <u>React Under Fire</u> by letting your plated hull take the hit, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, take another +1 momentum as you surge through the chaos and put yourself in perfect position. On a miss, <u>Pay the Price</u> by marking this component as broken.

Module
Research Lab

When you use your lab to <u>Secure an Advantage</u> or <u>Gather Information</u> through careful analysis or experimentation, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> to isolate or secure a hazardous specimen, reroll any dice.

When you <u>Swear an Iron Vow</u> to undertake a long-term research project, reroll any dice. When you obtain crucial samples, equipment, or data, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. When you have what you need and devote extended time to the project in your lab, <u>Face Danger</u> and add +1 to see how you fare. On a hit, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. On a strong hit with a match, mark progress. When you <u>Fulfill Your Vow</u>, make the legacy reward one rank higher (1 extra box if already epic).

Module
Sensor Array

Your advanced sensors scan the paths ahead to help spot dangers. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+wits), and roll a 10 on only one challenge die, you may reroll that die.

When you <u>Secure an Advantage</u> or <u>Gather Information</u> by scanning your vehicles surroundings or analyzing a nearby object, choose one and take +1 momentum on a hit.<br> * Manual scan: Add +1<br> * Automated scan: Instead of rolling the action die, make it the value of your vehicles integrity

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> against an ambush, or <u>Face Danger</u> to detect a hidden threat, you may roll +integrity. If you do, reroll any dice and take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Shields

When you raise your shields, roll +your vehicle's integrity or +wits. On a strong hit, set your shields to 4. On a weak hit, make them 3. On a miss, make them 2 but <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1). Then, if you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, ignore damage up to the value of your shields and suffer -1 shields. Raised shields last for a few minutes. If reduced to 0, they cannot be raised again for an hour or so.

You may <u>React Under Fire</u> by letting your shields take the blow. If you do, roll +shields and take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> and score a strong hit, you may raise your shields to 3 without rolling. If you do, take +1 momentum.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Module
Stealth Tech

When you make a move against a specific foe or threat to avoid detection, add +1. If you <u>Enter the Fray</u> by ambushing an unaware foe, add +1 and mark progress on a strong hit.

When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+shadow), and roll a 1 on your action die, you may reroll it.

When you are poised to <u>Strike</u> from hiding, you may roll +shadow. If you do, choose one (before rolling).<br> * Strike true: Reroll any dice.<br> * Strike hard: Mark progress on a hit. <br><br>On a strong hit with a match, you also remain totally undetected; take +2 momentum and add +1 on your next <u>Strike</u>.

Module
Vehicle Bay

You may purchase or upgrade a support vehicle for 1 less experience. When you <u>Repair</u> a battered support vehicle, spend 1 repair point (instead of 2).

When a support vehicle is destroyed, and you are able to retrieve its wreckage, you may <u>Ask the Oracle</u> using the yes/no table if something can be salvaged from the mess. Make it 50/50. On a yes, spend 2 experience to restore the support vehicle asset with all previously marked abilities. Until you <u>Repair</u> and bring it back to full working order, the vehicle is battered with 0 integrity.

When you make a move to launch from or land on your command vehicle in a perilous situation or environment, reroll any dice and take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Workshop

When you <u>Repair</u> in the field, add +1.

When you make a move in your workshop to craft, modify, deactivate, or disassemble a device or machine, you may reroll your action die if its value is less than your vehicles integrity.

When you <u>Swear an Iron Vow</u> to undertake a long-term engineering project, reroll any dice. When you obtain a crucial part or resource, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. When you have what you need and devote extended time in your workshop to the project, <u>Face Danger</u> and add +1 to see how you fare. On a hit, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. On a strong hit with a match, mark progress. When you <u>Fulfill Your Vow</u>, make the legacy reward one rank higher (1 extra box if already epic).

Support Vehicles

Support Vehicle
Exosuit
Name

Your lumbering rig houses one pilot, is sealed against hostile environments, and is armed with fixed or held weapons. When you make a forceful, damaging, or resistant move, you may (after rolling) replace the value of your action die with the rigs integrity; if you do, <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1).

Your exosuit is equipped with thrusters. You can maneuver in zero-g, make thrust-assisted leaps, and drop to a surface from altitude. When you burn fuel to overcome a critical obstacle (decide after rolling), you may reroll any dice. If you do, <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> (-1).

When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, you may reroll one challenge die.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5
+ 6
Support Vehicle
Hoverbike
Name

Your unarmed hoverbike provides speedy planetside transport, and is equipped to carry up to two people and their gear. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+edge), take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, you also surge ahead or find a new path; mark progress.

When you fire the bike's afterburner and make a move to perform a risky maneuver, you may add +integrity and take +2 momentum on a strong hit. If you do, count a weak hit as a miss.

When you make a move while maneuvering your bike and burn momentum to improve your result, roll your action die. On a 5 or 6, do not reset momentum.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
Support Vehicle
Rover
Name

Your unarmed rover provides protected planetside transport. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> or <u>Set a Course</u>, add +1. When you <u>Finish an Expedition</u> in your rover, you may reroll one challenge die.

You may equip your rover with one module asset at no extra cost. When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, the module can be broken or destroyed as with a command vehicle. If you reconfigure your rover, spend 1 experience, discard the module, and equip another with the same number of marked abilities.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> or <u>React Under Fire</u> by taking a hit or crashing through an obstacle, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5
Support Vehicle
Service Pod
Name

Your utility vehicle houses one pilot for short- range, low gravity operations. When you make a move using the pods manipulator arms to perform a delicate or forceful task, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Face Danger</u>, <u>Gain Ground</u>, or <u>React Under Fire</u> by maneuvering your pod through a hazardous or obstructed area, choose an approach and roll +integrity.<br> * Careful: Add +2 and <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1)<br> * Reckless: Take +1 momentum on a hit

When you make a move while controlling the pod and push its capabilities to the limit, you may take an automatic strong hit. If you do, <u>Withstand Damage</u> (-2).

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Support Vehicle
Shuttle
Name

Your unarmed shuttle provides short-range transport for several people and equipment through space or atmosphere. When you travel to a location (not your command vehicle), you and your allies may take +1 momentum when you arrive.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> or <u>React Under Fire</u> to navigate through hazardous skies or around obstacles, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

You shuttle is sealed against high pressure environments, can travel underwater, and is more resistant to damage; when you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, add +1.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Support Vehicle
Skiff
Name

Your unarmed flatbed hover-vehicle carries several people, gear, and cargo over land or water. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> or <u>Set a Course</u>, you may rely on the skiff's simple reliability and roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

Your skiff is armed with a turreted cannon. When you <u>Strike</u> or <u>Clash</u> by firing the cannon, roll +integrity and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, your shots cause extra destruction or create havoc; mark progress.

Your skiff is fully stocked. When you <u>Check Your Gear</u>, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Support Vehicle
Snub Fighter
Name

Your snub fighter carries a single pilot for space or atmospheric flight and combat. When you <u>Enter the Fray</u>, you may roll +integrity; if you do, take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Strike</u> or <u>Clash</u>, add +1. On a strong hit with a match, mark progress.

When you personally defeat a notable foe in your snub fighter, envision the victory mark you make on the fuselage. Track your victories in this box. For every five, mark 2 ticks on your quests legacy track.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4

NAME:

LOCATION:

DESCRIPTORS:


Command Vehicle
Starship
Name

Your armed, multipurpose starship is suited for interstellar and atmospheric flight. It can comfortably transport several people, has space for cargo, and can carry and launch support vehicles. When you <u>Advance</u>, you may spend experience to equip this vehicle with module assets.

When you <u>Finish an Expedition</u> (dangerous or greater) in your starship and score a hit, this journey strengthened your ties to your ship and any fellow travelers. You and your allies may mark 1 tick on your bonds legacy track.

When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, you may roll +heart. If you do, <u>Endure Stress</u> (-1) on a weak hit or miss.

Integrity

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5

Impacts

Passengers

Cargo

Modules

Module
Engine Upgrade

Your vehicles finely-tuned engines speed your travels. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+edge) and roll a strong hit with 6 on your action die, take +2 momentum.

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u>, choose one (before rolling).<br> * Maneuver: Add +1 and take +1 momentum on a strong hit.<br> * Boost: Take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you make a desperate move to pursue a foe, escape a threat, or get in range, you may push your engines to their limit. If you do (decide after rolling), reroll any dice and count a weak hit as a strong hit. Then, <u>Withstand Damage</u> (-2).

Module
Expanded Hold

Your vehicle carries up to 3 cargo. When you gain +supply, you may convert it to +cargo. When you make a move +supply, you may add +cargo. When you <u>Sacrifice Resources</u>, you may instead suffer -cargo for any portion of the cost.

When you roll a miss or weak hit as you make a move to barter or negotiate, and you have at least 1 cargo, you may sweeten the pot. If you do, reroll all dice and add +cargo. Then, suffer -1 cargo.

When you make a move to outrun a threat and have at least 1 cargo, you may first lighten your load by dropping cargo. If you do, suffer -cargo by the amount dropped, add +that amount, and take +2 momentum on a hit.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
Module
Grappler

Your grappler can disrupt systems and snare machines and vehicles with a magnetic tether. When you take a minute or so to ready the grappler, roll +integrity or +wits. On a strong hit, the grappler is charged and may be fired. On a weak hit, charging requires extra time or focus and you <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1). On a miss, charging fails and you must <u>Withstand Damage</u> (-2). If you make a move to attack a foe or overcome an obstacle by firing the grappler, take an automatic strong hit.

If you score a strong hit when readying the grappler, you may <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> (-1) to overcharge the module. When you fire an overcharged grappler, take +2 momentum; if in a fight, also mark progress.

When you <u>Take Decisive Action</u> by firing the grappler, you may reroll one challenge die.

Module
Heavy Cannons

When you aim your cannons and use them to <u>Strike</u>, choose one.<br> * Strafing run: Add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.<br> * Focus fire: Mark progress on a hit, but <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1).

Once per fight, when you <u>Clash</u> by committing to an all-or-nothing exchange of fire, add +1, count a weak hit as a strong hit, and mark progress on a hit. On a miss, you must suffer a dire outcome.

When you <u>Compel</u>, <u>Enter the Fray</u>, or <u>Gain Ground</u> by bringing your cannons to bear and sending a promise of violence to your foe over communication channels, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, take another +1 momentum.

Module
Internal Refit

You have customized the cabins, common spaces, and environment of the ship to your needs. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (dangerous or greater), reroll any dice for the first leg of your journey. On a hit, you and your allies may envision how you make yourself at home; if you do, take +2 momentum or +1 spirit.

Your vessel is stocked with reserves. When you <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> and your supply is reduced to 0, first roll +integrity instead of marking unprepared. On a strong hit, take +1 supply. Otherwise, mark unprepared.

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> to oppose an invader within your vessel, reroll any dice. On a strong hit, take +momentum equal to integrity. On a strong hit with a match, also mark progress.

Module
Medbay

When you use your medbay to <u>Heal</u> yourself or another patient, you may reroll your action die if its value is less than your vehicles integrity.

When you or an ally mark the permanently harmed impact and are brought to the medbay without delay (less than an hour or so), you have a shot at making things right. If you <u>Heal</u> and score a strong hit, clear the impact (in addition to the other benefits of the move). Then, envision the scar that now serves as a reminder of the incident.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> by performing a risky medical procedure, or if you <u>Gather Information</u> through an autopsy or internal scan, reroll any dice and take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Missile Array

Your missile array is armed with 5 ammo. When you <u>Strike</u> or <u>Clash</u> with a missile attack, suffer -1 ammo and mark progress on a hit. If you <u>Resupply</u> in a place where your missiles can be replenished, you may exchange any earned +supply for +ammo.

When you have at least 1 ammo and <u>Gain Ground</u> by locking a missile on target, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you have at least 3 ammo and <u>Take Decisive Action</u> by unleashing all of your missiles, roll an action die before making the progress roll. If your action die is equal to or less than ammo, you may reroll each challenge die. Then, set ammo to 0.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5
Module
Overseer
Name

Your AI module keeps watch over the vehicles systems and sensor data. When you <u>Secure an Advantage</u> or <u>Gain Ground</u> by talking through a situation with the overseer, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Withstand Damage</u> and roll on the miss table, the overseer will do what it can to help. Roll twice on the table and choose either result.

The overseer can pilot the vehicle independently. When you <u>Face Danger</u> to hand over control to the AI in an emergency, or to summon the vehicle remotely, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Reinforced Hull

Your vehicle is clad in iron. When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, add +1. On a strong hit, take +1 momentum.

Your plated hull is given a fierce and distinctive color or design. When you arrive at a place where your reputation is a factor, take +1 momentum. When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> against a foe who would know your reputation, take +momentum equal to your vehicles integrity on a strong hit.

When you <u>React Under Fire</u> by letting your plated hull take the hit, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, take another +1 momentum as you surge through the chaos and put yourself in perfect position. On a miss, <u>Pay the Price</u> by marking this component as broken.

Module
Research Lab

When you use your lab to <u>Secure an Advantage</u> or <u>Gather Information</u> through careful analysis or experimentation, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> to isolate or secure a hazardous specimen, reroll any dice.

When you <u>Swear an Iron Vow</u> to undertake a long-term research project, reroll any dice. When you obtain crucial samples, equipment, or data, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. When you have what you need and devote extended time to the project in your lab, <u>Face Danger</u> and add +1 to see how you fare. On a hit, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. On a strong hit with a match, mark progress. When you <u>Fulfill Your Vow</u>, make the legacy reward one rank higher (1 extra box if already epic).

Module
Sensor Array

Your advanced sensors scan the paths ahead to help spot dangers. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+wits), and roll a 10 on only one challenge die, you may reroll that die.

When you <u>Secure an Advantage</u> or <u>Gather Information</u> by scanning your vehicles surroundings or analyzing a nearby object, choose one and take +1 momentum on a hit.<br> * Manual scan: Add +1<br> * Automated scan: Instead of rolling the action die, make it the value of your vehicles integrity

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> against an ambush, or <u>Face Danger</u> to detect a hidden threat, you may roll +integrity. If you do, reroll any dice and take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Shields

When you raise your shields, roll +your vehicle's integrity or +wits. On a strong hit, set your shields to 4. On a weak hit, make them 3. On a miss, make them 2 but <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1). Then, if you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, ignore damage up to the value of your shields and suffer -1 shields. Raised shields last for a few minutes. If reduced to 0, they cannot be raised again for an hour or so.

You may <u>React Under Fire</u> by letting your shields take the blow. If you do, roll +shields and take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Enter the Fray</u> and score a strong hit, you may raise your shields to 3 without rolling. If you do, take +1 momentum.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Module
Stealth Tech

When you make a move against a specific foe or threat to avoid detection, add +1. If you <u>Enter the Fray</u> by ambushing an unaware foe, add +1 and mark progress on a strong hit.

When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+shadow), and roll a 1 on your action die, you may reroll it.

When you are poised to <u>Strike</u> from hiding, you may roll +shadow. If you do, choose one (before rolling).<br> * Strike true: Reroll any dice.<br> * Strike hard: Mark progress on a hit. <br><br>On a strong hit with a match, you also remain totally undetected; take +2 momentum and add +1 on your next <u>Strike</u>.

Module
Vehicle Bay

You may purchase or upgrade a support vehicle for 1 less experience. When you <u>Repair</u> a battered support vehicle, spend 1 repair point (instead of 2).

When a support vehicle is destroyed, and you are able to retrieve its wreckage, you may <u>Ask the Oracle</u> using the yes/no table if something can be salvaged from the mess. Make it 50/50. On a yes, spend 2 experience to restore the support vehicle asset with all previously marked abilities. Until you <u>Repair</u> and bring it back to full working order, the vehicle is battered with 0 integrity.

When you make a move to launch from or land on your command vehicle in a perilous situation or environment, reroll any dice and take +1 momentum on a hit.

Module
Workshop

When you <u>Repair</u> in the field, add +1.

When you make a move in your workshop to craft, modify, deactivate, or disassemble a device or machine, you may reroll your action die if its value is less than your vehicles integrity.

When you <u>Swear an Iron Vow</u> to undertake a long-term engineering project, reroll any dice. When you obtain a crucial part or resource, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. When you have what you need and devote extended time in your workshop to the project, <u>Face Danger</u> and add +1 to see how you fare. On a hit, <u>Reach a Milestone</u>. On a strong hit with a match, mark progress. When you <u>Fulfill Your Vow</u>, make the legacy reward one rank higher (1 extra box if already epic).

Support Vehicles

Support Vehicle
Exosuit
Name

Your lumbering rig houses one pilot, is sealed against hostile environments, and is armed with fixed or held weapons. When you make a forceful, damaging, or resistant move, you may (after rolling) replace the value of your action die with the rigs integrity; if you do, <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1).

Your exosuit is equipped with thrusters. You can maneuver in zero-g, make thrust-assisted leaps, and drop to a surface from altitude. When you burn fuel to overcome a critical obstacle (decide after rolling), you may reroll any dice. If you do, <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> (-1).

When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, you may reroll one challenge die.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5
+ 6
Support Vehicle
Hoverbike
Name

Your unarmed hoverbike provides speedy planetside transport, and is equipped to carry up to two people and their gear. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> (+edge), take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, you also surge ahead or find a new path; mark progress.

When you fire the bike's afterburner and make a move to perform a risky maneuver, you may add +integrity and take +2 momentum on a strong hit. If you do, count a weak hit as a miss.

When you make a move while maneuvering your bike and burn momentum to improve your result, roll your action die. On a 5 or 6, do not reset momentum.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
Support Vehicle
Rover
Name

Your unarmed rover provides protected planetside transport. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> or <u>Set a Course</u>, add +1. When you <u>Finish an Expedition</u> in your rover, you may reroll one challenge die.

You may equip your rover with one module asset at no extra cost. When you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, the module can be broken or destroyed as with a command vehicle. If you reconfigure your rover, spend 1 experience, discard the module, and equip another with the same number of marked abilities.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> or <u>React Under Fire</u> by taking a hit or crashing through an obstacle, you may roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
+ 5
Support Vehicle
Service Pod
Name

Your utility vehicle houses one pilot for short- range, low gravity operations. When you make a move using the pods manipulator arms to perform a delicate or forceful task, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Face Danger</u>, <u>Gain Ground</u>, or <u>React Under Fire</u> by maneuvering your pod through a hazardous or obstructed area, choose an approach and roll +integrity.<br> * Careful: Add +2 and <u>Lose Momentum</u> (-1)<br> * Reckless: Take +1 momentum on a hit

When you make a move while controlling the pod and push its capabilities to the limit, you may take an automatic strong hit. If you do, <u>Withstand Damage</u> (-2).

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Support Vehicle
Shuttle
Name

Your unarmed shuttle provides short-range transport for several people and equipment through space or atmosphere. When you travel to a location (not your command vehicle), you and your allies may take +1 momentum when you arrive.

When you <u>Face Danger</u> or <u>React Under Fire</u> to navigate through hazardous skies or around obstacles, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

You shuttle is sealed against high pressure environments, can travel underwater, and is more resistant to damage; when you <u>Withstand Damage</u>, add +1.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Support Vehicle
Skiff
Name

Your unarmed flatbed hover-vehicle carries several people, gear, and cargo over land or water. When you <u>Undertake an Expedition</u> or <u>Set a Course</u>, you may rely on the skiff's simple reliability and roll +integrity. If you do, take +1 momentum on a hit.

Your skiff is armed with a turreted cannon. When you <u>Strike</u> or <u>Clash</u> by firing the cannon, roll +integrity and take +1 momentum on a hit. On a strong hit with a match, your shots cause extra destruction or create havoc; mark progress.

Your skiff is fully stocked. When you <u>Check Your Gear</u>, add +1 and take +1 momentum on a hit.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4
Support Vehicle
Snub Fighter
Name

Your snub fighter carries a single pilot for space or atmospheric flight and combat. When you <u>Enter the Fray</u>, you may roll +integrity; if you do, take +2 momentum on a hit.

When you <u>Strike</u> or <u>Clash</u>, add +1. On a strong hit with a match, mark progress.

When you personally defeat a notable foe in your snub fighter, envision the victory mark you make on the fuselage. Track your victories in this box. For every five, mark 2 ticks on your quests legacy track.

0
+ 1
+ 2
+ 3
+ 4

{{campaign-starship-history}}
{{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 1 8}} Acquired in trade for a precious family heirloom {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 1 8}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 9 17}} Built out of re-purposed scrap {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 9 17}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 18 25}} Claimed as spoils of war {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 18 25}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 26 34}} Discovered as a derelict, and patched back together {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 26 34}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 35 42}} Earned in exchange for a promise or vow {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 35 42}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 43 50}} Found abandoned in perfect condition {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 43 50}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 51 58}} Granted by an organization or community {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 51 58}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 59 67}} Inherited from a relative or mentor {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 59 67}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 68 75}} Purchased at a suspiciously cheap price {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 68 75}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 76 84}} Stolen from a notorious crime boss or criminal organization {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 76 84}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 85 92}} Taken while fleeing an attack or disaster {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 85 92}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 93 100}} Won in a bet {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-history 93 100}}
{{/campaign-starship-history}} {{#campaign-starship-quirks}}
{{campaign-starship-quirks}}
{{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 1 5}} Engine room is scorched with old burn marks {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 1 5}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 6 10}} Exterior is marred by rust and grime {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 6 10}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 11 15}} Faint, phantom music sometimes echoes through the corridors {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 11 15}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 16 20}} Gravity generator is notoriously fickle {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 16 20}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 21 25}} Hull is fused with organic growths {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 21 25}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 26 30}} Hull rattles and groans in atmospheric flight {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 26 30}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 31 35}} Interior spaces are crowded with exposed cables and conduits {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 31 35}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 36 40}} Looks defenseless, but exterior panels open to reveal weapons {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 36 40}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 41 45}} Navigation logs contain coordinates to locations that do notor should notexist {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 41 45}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 46 50}} Old bloodstain in the airlock reappears even when painted over {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 46 50}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 51 55}} Once a beautiful ship, now scarred by a devastating battle {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 51 55}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 56 60}} Patched hull covers a recent catastrophic breach {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 56 60}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 61 65}} Placards and control labels are in an uncommon language {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 61 65}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 66 70}} Removable plate decks provide access to hidden storage {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 66 70}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 71 75}} Segmented landing gear unfold like gangly spider legs {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 71 75}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 76 80}} Ship is powered by an ancient precursor device {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 76 80}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 81 85}} Someone marked the hull with graffiti during a recent layover {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 81 85}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 86 90}} Strange symbols are scrawled on the deck and bulkheads in the main corridor {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 86 90}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 91 95}} Things tend to go missing for no logical reason {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 91 95}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 96 100}} Timers and clocks are always just a bit off {{/rollBetween() campaign-starship-quirks 96 100}}
{{/campaign-starship-quirks}} {{#campaign-sector-trouble}}
{{campaign-sector-trouble}}
{{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 1 5}} Blockade prevents trade with other sectors {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 1 5}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 6 10}} Bounty hunters search for an infamous fugitive {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 6 10}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 11 15}} Chaotic breaches in spacetime spread like wildfire {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 11 15}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 16 20}} Criminal faction corrupts local authorities {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 16 20}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 21 25}} Devastating superweapon has fallen into the wrong hands {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 21 25}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 26 30}} Energy storms are rampant {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 26 30}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 31 35}} Magnetic disturbances disrupt communication {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 31 35}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 36 40}} Newly found resource lures greedy fortune hunters to the sector {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 36 40}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 41 45}} Notorious pirate clan preys on starships {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 41 45}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 46 50}} Parasitic lifeforms spread like a plague {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 46 50}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 51 55}} Precursor sites throughout the sector emit strange signals {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 51 55}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 56 60}} Prophecies foretell an imminent awakening of a dreadful power {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 56 60}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 61 65}} Raider clan emerges as a dominant threat under a new leader {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 61 65}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 66 70}} Religious zealots overrun the sector {{/rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 66 70}} {{#rollBetween() campaign-sector-trouble 71 75}} Rogue AI infiltrates systems throughout the sector {{character-creation-starship-history}}

{{character-creation-starship-quirks}}
{{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 1 5}} Engine room is scorched with old burn marks {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 1 5}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 6 10}} Exterior is marred by rust and grime {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 6 10}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 11 15}} Faint, phantom music sometimes echoes through the corridors {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 11 15}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 16 20}} Gravity generator is notoriously fickle {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 16 20}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 21 25}} Hull is fused with organic growths {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 21 25}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 26 30}} Hull rattles and groans in atmospheric flight {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 26 30}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 31 35}} Interior spaces are crowded with exposed cables and conduits {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 31 35}} character-creation-starship-quirks 41 45}} Navigation logs contain coordinates to locations that do notor should notexist {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 41 45}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 46 50}} Old bloodstain in the airlock reappears even when painted over {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 46 50}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 51 55}} Once a beautiful ship, now scarred by a devastating battle {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 51 55}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 56 60}} Patched hull covers a recent catastrophic breach {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 56 60}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 61 65}} Placards and control labels are in an uncommon language {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 61 65}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 66 70}} Removable plate decks provide access to hidden storage {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 66 70}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 76 80}} Ship is powered by an ancient precursor device {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 76 80}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 81 85}} Someone marked the hull with graffiti during a recent layover {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 81 85}} {{#rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 96 100}} Timers and clocks are always just a bit off {{/rollBetween() character-creation-starship-quirks 96 100}}

{{move-take-decisive-action}}
{{#rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 1 40}} Its worse than you thought: You or an ally make a suffer move (-2) {{/rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 1 40}} {{#rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 41 52}} The victory is short-lived: A new peril or foe is revealed {{/rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 41 52}} {{#rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 53 64}} You face collateral damage: Something is lost, damaged, or broken {{/rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 53 64}} {{#rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 65 76}} Others pay the price: Someone else suffers the cost {{/rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 65 76}} {{#rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 77 88}} Others wont forget: You are marked for vengeance {{/rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 77 88}} {{#rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 89 100}} It gets complicated: The true nature of a foe or objective is revealed {{/rollBetween() move-take-decisive-action 89 100}}
{{/move-take-decisive-action}} {{#move-endure-harm}}
{{move-endure-harm}}
{{#rollBetween() move-endure-harm 1 10}} You suffer mortal harm. <u>Face Death</u>. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-harm 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-harm 11 20}} You are dying. Within an hour or two, you must <u>Heal</u> and raise your health above 0, or <u>Face Death</u>. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-harm 11 20}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-harm 21 35}} You are unconscious and out of action. If left alone, you come back to your senses in an hour or two. If you are vulnerable to ongoing harm, <u>Face Death</u>. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-harm 21 35}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-harm 36 50}} You are reeling and fighting to stay conscious. If you engage in any vigorous activity before taking a breather for a few minutes, roll on this table again (before resolving the other move). {{/rollBetween() move-endure-harm 36 50}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-harm 51 100}} You are still standing. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-harm 51 100}}
{{/move-endure-harm}} {{#move-endure-stress}}
{{move-endure-stress}}
{{#rollBetween() move-endure-stress 1 10}} You are overwhelmed. <u>Face Desolation</u>. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-stress 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-stress 11 25}} You give up. <u>Forsake Your Vow</u>. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-stress 11 25}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-stress 26 50}} You give in to fear or compulsion, and act against your better instincts. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-stress 26 50}} {{#rollBetween() move-endure-stress 51 100}} You persevere. {{/rollBetween() move-endure-stress 51 100}}
{{/move-endure-stress}} {{#move-withstand-damage}}
{{move-withstand-damage}}
{{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 1 10}} Immediate catastrophic destruction. All aboard must <u>Endure Harm</u> or <u>Face Death</u>, as appropriate. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 1 10}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 11 25}} Destruction is imminent and unavoidable. If you do not have the means or intention to get clear, <u>Endure Harm</u> or <u>Face Death</u> as appropriate. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 11 25}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 26 40}} Destruction is imminent, but can be averted if you <u>Repair</u> your vehicle and raise its integrity above 0. If you fail, see 11-25. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 26 40}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 41 55}} You cannot <u>Repair</u> this vehicle until you <u>Resupply</u> and obtain a crucial replacement part. If you roll this result again prior to that, see 11-25. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 41 55}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 56 70}} The vehicle is crippled or out of your control. To get it back in action, you must <u>Repair</u> and raise its integrity above 0. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 56 70}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 71 85}} Its a rough ride. All aboard suffer must make the <u>Endure Harm</u>, <u>Endure Stress</u>, or <u>Companion Takes a Hit</u> move, suffering a serious (-2) cost. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 71 85}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 86 95}} Youve lost fuel, energy, or cargo. <u>Sacrifice Resources</u> (-2). {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 86 95}} {{#rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 96 100}} Against all odds, the vehicle holds together. {{/rollBetween() move-withstand-damage 96 100}}
{{/move-withstand-damage}} {{#move-pay-the-price}}
{{move-pay-the-price}}
{{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 1 2}} A trusted individual or community acts against you {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 1 2}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 3 4}} An individual or community you care about is exposed to danger {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 3 4}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 5 7}} You encounter signs of a looming threat {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 5 7}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 8 10}} You create an opportunity for an enemy {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 8 10}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 11 14}} You face a tough choice {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 11 14}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 15 18}} You face the consequences of an earlier choice {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 15 18}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 19 22}} A surprising development complicates your quest {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 19 22}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 23 26}} You are separated from something or someone {{/rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 23 26}} {{#rollBetween() move-pay-the-price 27 32}} Your action causes collateral damage or has an unintended effect {{/rollBetween()
